Hi Dong,

Yes, in my application I'm actually more interested in a "blind" =
toggle like the pull handle of a slot machine.  (Perhaps that would be a be=
tter example going forward)

Regarding the POST, I'm still a bit confused a=
s to how this would be constructed.  In my applications, I've tended to use=
 the POST method on "collection" resources to create a new resource that is=
 a member of the collection.  It seems to me if one had a resource /pullHan=
dle and simply used POST with an empty body, that we are really heading dow=
n the RPC route rather than being RESTful.  This also overloads the semanti=
cs of POST ("POST as create a member" and "POST as ?activate?").  Am I just=
 overthinking here?

Thanks,
Robby
